ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Lvl 52 song
ygData.msgSnippet: definitely true.  and you are right, i never have charm memmed anymore, SoT is in its place.  usually i am not in places where i can charm, and when i am i
ygData.messageBody:
definitely true. and you are right, i never have charm memmed anymore, SoT
is in its place. usually i am not in places where i can charm, and when i
am i prefer SoT since it is a definite 18 seconds, no early breaks, nothing
beating on me if i miss the recharm and needing a heal from someone,
together i think outweighs the extra damage my pet would be doing, since i'm
usually in a fast-killing group. and like i said, a lot of the stuff i am
fighting for exp now is uncharmable and even unmessable. i used the hell
out of charm pre-velious and pre-SoT fix.

song line-up changes a lot, and i am lazy in exp groups since we are usually
never in danger and on single pulls, so i know i could be doing a lot more
and if there is any danger i'll fire up what's needed. my line-up in a
normal exp group, which is usually tank heavy, is the following. i switch
out 3,4,5 or whatever for the 3 chants if a caster group or solo. lately i
have been singing a single chant for the of extra damage, dunno why i never
did it before (see laziness above). should have been doing it ever since i
got my SSS.

1) Selo's (changes to Invis or Lull indoors)
2) Cantana (never changes)
3) Song of Dawn (changes to Resist song #2 or chant if needed)
4) McVaxius Rousing Rondo (never changes)
5) Occlusion of Sound (changes to Resist song #1 or chant if needed)
6) Song of Twilight (never changes)
7) Largo's Absonant Binding (never changes, been using 23 chains forever
because when i first got 51 binding i thought i remember it being a lower
slowdown)
8) Screech (never changes, see below)

any of the songs that are not "never changes" of course i can swap out for
any rarely used or situational song i may need, e.g. charimsatic carillion.
as far as #8 Appaling Screech, i really need to rethink this. i am never in
an area anymore where this song will not be resisted by everything i sing it
on. it used to be such a handy song, but with the fear cap i need something
else here, any suggestions?

Shada

> definitely that large difference in the way we play is going
> to result in a large
> difference of our views on the class. for example while most
> of us consider
> charm a staple song, you probably don't even have it memmed
> most of the
> time, right? actually it would be kind of interesting to see
> what your ''normal''
> song list does contain, if you don't mind giving out that info, heh.
